name: Burger Joint at Le Parker Meridien Hotel

reviews.text: Atypic burger restaurant located almost in the lobby of the Parker Meridien.
reviews.title: Atypic burger restaurant located in a luxury hotel
Hole in the wall fun
reviews.text: This is a good restaurant for a lunch or for a afternoon burger break.

reviews.title: A very cool burger
reviews.text: For lunch, except to queue up.

reviews.title: LoVe these burgers
reviews.text: Restaurant is atypic, not very beautiful and without any window but burgers are good.

reviews.title: Food and atmosphere were cool and amazing!
reviews.text: No menu, only cheese/hamburgers with fries and soda.

reviews.title: a secret treat
reviews.text: a tasty hidden pleasure tucked into a corner of the Parker's lobby. If you see a line of people going into a dark door to nowhere, get in behind them and get yourself a well-sized burger, excellent fries and a cup of beer. perfection

reviews.title: small burgers
reviews.text: The burger was good, but tiny. Smaller than an "In and Out"'s double double. Since it is cook to order, it taste great. Fries are good too. Shake are OK. Overall it is a great place for a snack. If you are hungry, this is not the place for you

reviews.title: My Número Uno
reviews.text: The burger is just good. They use quality meat and you taste it. Very basic menu. Fries are excellent too. I have to this day not been dealt a limp fry from this place for which I am grateful.

reviews.title: OH-MY-GOD
reviews.text: The ques, the waiting, the waiting and anticipation: it is all worth it! :-) Great place to dine, I liked the burgers a LOT. In fact, in America, I have yet not had a burger this tasty! Great place, and loved the chocolate milkshake as well!

This little (very little) non-conspicuous burger joint is inside the Parker Meridian Hotel on W. 56th St. The only way we knew this place existed is because we saw it on an Anthony Bourdain show. When we entered the hotel we had to ask where to find it as there are no signs to show you. Behind a curtain behind the check in desk we found this gem. I had the cheese burger med-rare with the works. This burger melted in my mouth!!! Cash only so be prepared.
reviews.title: Best burger I have ever had!
Fun Burger Joint
reviews.text: Fun Burger joint tucked into the Parker Meridien hotel. There is always a line as the joint is small with not many tables. The line moves quick as your order your burger at the counter (Hamburger or Cheeseburger) and your burger is up within just a few minutes. If you are hungry for a burger and in the area, Midtown (57th street) pop in, you won't be disappointed.

reviews.title: Wonderful burger
reviews.text: Really good and worth the wait, especially if you are really hungry.

reviews.title: Tasted like a Whopper
reviews.text: Hey, for a late-night burger fix, it was fine. I have nothing against BK. I just expected a little more, y'know, seeing as how it's in the lobby of this fairly upscale hotel and all.

reviews.title: Good Burger
reviews.text: A good place for a burger, but I'd be surprised that this is the best burger in NY.

reviews.title: Such a gem
reviews.text: So hidden in the hotel! but so glad we found it. The burgers were delish. And the place has such character. With scribbled writing on its walls and the menu hanging above the counter made out of cardboard. We were told that the queues can be out the door at times and full of locals.

reviews.title: hidden burger
reviews.text: Surprisingly hidden behind a heavy curtain inside the meridien hotel, the burger joint gives you a bite of true ny itself. it's a dark small place and burgers are delicious! too bad we went there a bit too late, so they were out french fries and beer :( nevermind, for sure i'll get there as soon as i get back to nyc!

reviews.title: Best All American Burger!
reviews.text: This is a tiny place hidden in the Meridien, but the burger is well worth the wait in even a long line if you are a burger fan. The patty had just the right amount of grill, meat was fabulous, bun very light, and their fries are delicious.

reviews.title: The Best Burgers in NYC by far.
reviews.text: Unfortunately, they have become a victim of their own success and the lines are very very long. Try to become hungry at a non peak time and you will not be dissappointed.

You should definitely go here. If not for the burgers - just to enjoy the unique room and the entertaining staff behind the counter. The burger is pretty straight forward. Paddy, bun, the works and no nonsense.
reviews.title: A must-try experience
Good honest burger
reviews.text: The kids loved this place given its hidden away in the hotel lobby but despite this the burgers were very decent. Simple burgers with great taste. No corporate gimmick or chain restaurant gimmicks - just a great burger

reviews.title: OK burger
reviews.text: Burger good but not the best I've tasted, not even the best in NYC. The place is a bit of a dive in stark contract to the hotel in which it is housed. Staff very nice though. Waited 45 minutes before even getting through the door. Don't regret going though as it's another thing ticked off the list of what to do in Manhattan.

reviews.title: Good Burgers
reviews.text: It was a fun experience but a little pricey. Burgers were better than Bill's in my opinion. We went as soon as they opened so we were able to get our food quickly and have a seat. Unfortunately they did not have shakes while we were there. Would defin go again.

reviews.title: Is it worth it?
reviews.text: The lines are unbearably long and you will be extremely lucky to find a place inside. Nevertheless, give it a try, it is an experience.

The location is of course what makes this place so refreshing. Take anyone not in the know there, and the effect of surprise is guaranteed. And the succulent burgers are the finishers. They are very basic. And very delicious. Fun 10 out of 10. Taste 10 out of 10.
reviews.title: Surpriiiise!!!
good burger with a funny location...spoiler alert
reviews.text: It is a funny experience to walk thru the hallway from the marble court of the hotel to the wall paneled basement grill. Waiting in line should be considered part of the experience. Burgers are something to compare to the other exalted burger places.
I'd read various reviews about this place from different sources, the majority of which were positive so decided to pay it a visit on our trip to NYC last year.
reviews.title: Hidden (literally) gem - worth finding - great burgers !
Truly Hidden Gem
reviews.text: We eventually found the Parker Meridien Hotel and if it hadn't been for a queue which seemed to be going down the side of the reception desk, you wouldn't have known there was a burger joint there at all ! (admittedly if you peer down the corridor to the side of reception there is a little "burger" sign but other than that its pretty well hidden)

reviews.title: Good and greasy
reviews.text: we queued up for about 35 minutes in a queue consisting of New Yorkers and people from all over the world and all the time people were joining the queue. eventually we got to the doorway and could see what all the fuss was about !

Hard to describe the place - certainly busy, quite small and cramped - probably "interesting" was best way to describe it. My wife wasn't convinced but I assured her that base on all the writeups I had read this WAS the place to go for a burger. Signs up on the wall written in marker pen on bits of cardboard (yes really!) told you to make sure you knew EXACTLY what you wanted before you got to the counter and looking at the turnaround time at the counter, there was a reason for this ! we got the the counter, placed our order and managed to grab a table for the two of us while we waited for our food order which was soon shouted out to us.
reviews.title: Great greasy burger
Very rude and disorganized
reviews.text: It did exactly what it said on the tin - a paper wrapped burger, cooked as we asked, with all the filling we asked, some good fries and a drink. I seem to recall it wasn't the cheapest but it certainly was one of the best i've had.

reviews.title: Unexpected pleasure
reviews.text: Not a place you will go to and stumble upon by accodent. You only visit here if you are recomended it or told by someone who knows. It is a simple "burger joint" im the most unsuspecting of places.
The menu is simple and the place is pooring with character and charm.
reviews.title: Hidden but not-so-secret gem

reviews.text: No frills, no fancy trimmings. Just pure and simple and GOOD burgers.
reviews.title: Great burger and atmosphere!!!
Great Burger
reviews.text: Considering all the mentions this place has in lists of things to do in New York I was surprised how quiet it was when we went in not long after 12 last wednesday. Not knowing your order when you're at the front of the queue might normally cause a problem, but since there were only the 4 of us in the queue at that point it wasn't an issue.

reviews.title: A bargain at a classy hotel
reviews.text: The location inside the hotel is really cool and the staff were loud and certainly seemed to be having a good time, which added to the great informal atmosphere of the place.

reviews.title: Good homemade burger
reviews.text: The burger was good, but not worth a 2 hour wait like some folks had experienced. I especially enjoyed the milkshake moreso than anything else, but Ima sweets person anyway.

Step behind the red curtain in the lobby of the Le Parker Meridien Hotel and you will feel like you have stepped onto a movie set, very surreal. Even better, once you place your order you will be rewarded with an amazing juicy burger, and some very delicious thin fries. The price is right too!! Just be sure to get here before the lunch rush, there was a line snaking through the lobby by the time we left, and there are seats for less than 50 people.
reviews.title: Great Burger, Fun Find
Not up to the hype!
reviews.text: Ok ... so you have to find the entrance and wait in line, pray for a table. The burger is not bad, it is just not anything above and beyond what you can find somewhere else. It is a fun NYC place and visitors get a real kick out of being "in the know"

Slip into the exclusive lobby of the Parker Meridien, then scootch to the right and follow the neon burger sign. There, behind a simple partition, is one of the most memorable burger joints you will ever go to. It feels like time stolen, and is quintessential New York.
reviews.title: A NYC must-do
Bit too scruffy for my liking
reviews.text: Burgers were good but wait was 30 mins and the whole place is almost too scruffy. It maybe cool to have a menu hand written on a piece of cardboard, and certainly out of place in Manhattan, but if cleanliness in kitchen was at a similar level, you should be eating elsewhere. Just gives wrong first impression.
